text: the 2008 Summer Olympic Games an English
lesson for the advanced student the
Olympic Games happen only every four
years so if you're anything like me you
make a point of watching at least some
of the events if you'd like to know what
I enjoyed watching most in the 2008
Summer Olympic Games then listen closely
and you'll find out
this lesson will have three main parts
in part one will focus on vocabulary
skills part two listening skills and
part three
grammar skills

skills do you know these words bar crowd
breathtaking exhaustive exquisite host
impression memorable reflect resource
spectacular tough task one definitions
choose the correct definition let's do

failed to get over the bar and knocked
it down bar means a a long straight

breathtaking breathtaking means a

breathtaking it takes your breath away

their choice exhaustive means a short

Jamaican runners joyous celebration of

from the word family of memory and
memorize 9 the silence in the stadium
reflected the seriousness of the players
injury reflect means a to hurt B to

needs space and money to hold the
olympic games without these resources
being a host country is impossible a
resource means a what is needed B what

by force answer B note that this word is
often seen in the plural eleven the
parade of Nations is always spectacular
it's wonderful to see so many proud
athletes spectacular means a expensive
be long and boring or C large and
exciting
